page.title: 14BALLYMENA STATION
page.content: UP UNTIL 1967,THE BALLYMENA BUS STATION AND RAILWAY STATION WERE NAMED ONE UNDER THE UMBRELLA OF ULSTER TRANSPORT.AFTER THIS DATE THE TWO BECAME SEPARATE WITH DIFFERENT FINANCES MANAGERS AND WORKERS BUT THEY STILL SHARED THE SAME OLD PREMISES. IN FEBRUARY OF 1981 A NEW BUILDING WAS OPENED FOR THE RAILWAY- IT DIVIDED OFFICES, WAITING AREAS, TICKET OFFICES, SUBWAYS AND OF COURSE NEW PLATFORMS. IT WAS OPENED BY A MR. ROLLO. E. McCLURE.
